Lem.Action: Passionately operates the star machine and tries to give a lecture to kids despite being uneasy and stumbling.
Looks over at the curator with concern after making a mistake, indicating awareness and vulnerability.
Is the star machine operator and delivers a planetarium lecture, showing passion and some knowledge.
Is new and uneasy, stumbles and drops his script.
Accidentally knocks the star machine, causing stars to fly all over the dome.
Encourages himself to continue the presentation despite difficulties.
Engages audience with interesting facts, eliciting enjoyment and amazement.
Accidentally causes distress by putting the planet slide in wrong, leading to children’s fear and crying.
Feels uneasy and possibly embarrassed after the incident and the curator's reaction.
Delivers an educational presentation confidently and engages the audience with interesting facts about space.
Struggles to insert the slide correctly and causes a fire effect that scares the children.
Continues despite nervousness and uses visual aids effectively to explain complex ideas.
Fails to prevent or correct the mistake that disturbs and frightens the children during the presentation.
Misleads friends about results to surprise them positively with good news.
Responds condescendingly to Eckle's questions about aliens, dismisses him and taps his head to indicate brain damage.
Shares optimistic, warm vision of his future family and life with others.
Cautiously manages expectations when asked about marrying friend’s sister but confides happiness about the idea.
Condescends to Eckle about aliens and dismisses his questions, showing confidence in scientific knowledge.
Feels uneasy and covers his mouth when aware of the Curator overhearing Eckle, indicating self-consciousness and social caution.
Misleads friends about job status initially but then reveals he got the job, demonstrating social tact and confidence.
Expresses clear plans for the future enthusiastically and confidently, showing foresight and optimism.
Warns Eckle not to get ahead about marrying, showing prudent caution despite excitement.
Smiles and gives the Chief a thumbs up despite feeling slightly embarrassed.
Jokingly threatens to pretend he never met Skiff and Eckle if they attend the costume contest in costume.
Dismisses his friends' enthusiasm for sci-fi and aliens, claiming he doesn't believe in aliens and focusing on his job instead.
Smiles and gives the Chief a thumbs up when praised.
Rejects going to the costume contest and claims to be a planetarium professional, implying focus on his career.
Says he doesn't believe in aliens, despite evidence around him.
Dismisses Skiff's conspiracy theories with humor and skepticism.
Smiles warmly when seeing Neera and greets her sincerely.
Rejects Skiff's alien story bluntly: 'Don't listen to him. There's no such thing as aliens.'
Shares the good news about getting the job with neighbors and family, showing openness and friendliness.
Points confidently to the comic book store sign when making a point.
Dismisses the possibility of aliens despite an actual alien ship flying overhead unnoticed.
Smiles and interacts warmly with Neera, showing social ease and confidence.
Expresses hope for a future with Neera, showing sincere affection.
Lies to Neera about being okay with her leaving to join the protest.
Exchanges a concerned look with Neera when seeing the unusual situation with the alien ship.
Simply observes the chaotic reactions of adults around him without intervening or showing initiative.
Engages with Skiff upon his secretive approach, listens to his concerns about aliens.
Dismissively rejects Skiff's offer to share an air raid shelter by expressing disgust.
Initially dismisses the possibility of aliens but later admits he was wrong.
Listens to Skiff's warning and inspects the architectural plans for the air raid shelter.
Rejects Skiff's plan of spending six months underground with him, showing discernment.
Acts casual and slightly sarcastic when given a cork as defense, indicating confidence but not necessarily skill.
Greets Skiff and asks how he is holding up.
Is approached by Glar who tries to recruit him; Lem politely declines because he has to work.
Refuses to join Glar's protest because he has work to do, showing responsibility and prioritization.
Looks confused when Glar explains the protest, suggesting some difficulty understanding the social dynamics.
Feels bad seeing the astronaut panic due to oxygen leak and decides to help despite danger.
Takes a brave step to unhook the wires, enabling the astronaut to breathe and initiate communication.
Engages in playful banter and language exchange with the astronaut, showing openness and humor.
Questions the astronaut suspiciously about intentions to take over their world and eat brains.
Takes a brave step to unhook the wires, showing courage and initiative.
Successfully causes the astronaut's mobility system to fail, forcing him to confront a critical situation.
Engages in communication and quickly adapts to English language interaction, showing social and cognitive flexibility.
Makes a sarcastic or skeptical comment about the astronaut's purpose, showing cautiousness and critical thinking.
Appears confused at some points in the conversation, requiring clarification on words like 'Oprah' and alien status.
Agrees to help Chuck get to his flying saucer despite personal risk and uncertainty.
Expresses hesitation and concerns about getting in trouble before helping.
Agrees to help Chuck by driving him to the flying saucer despite potential trouble, showing responsible consideration and cautious commitment.
Expresses hesitation about getting into trouble before agreeing to help, indicating awareness and thoughtful decision-making.
Keeps calm during a stressful situation involving police sirens and a potential chase, and takes action with a plan.
Uses cautious language and sets clear boundaries ('then you're on your own!'), showing confidence in his decisions.
Hesitates and backs away from knocking out a cop, smiling uneasily at Chief Gorloc instead of following Chuck's illegal plan.
Hesitates before following Chuck's plan to incapacitate police; backs away instinctively instead of knocking out the officer as instructed.
Smiles uneasily and engages in a non-confrontational interaction with Chief Gorloc instead of committing to a risky or aggressive act.
Drives calmly to the location, reaching the main street as planned.
Stands between a soldier and the alien's car to protect the alien, showing impulsive defense despite trying to cover it up awkwardly.
Falsely claims the aliens want to eat brains with hot sauce, alarming others and discouraging peaceful interaction.
Stands protectively between soldier and car door, preventing search.
Attempts to cover suspicious behavior with a hastily fabricated story about aliens wanting brains.
Quickly notices the threat and acts to prevent it, showing situational awareness.
Appears nervous and unsure, tries to bluff instead of confidently addressing situation.
Sneaks Chuck upstairs and hides him, careful to keep him safe from discovery.
Struggles to keep his mom from finding Chuck, showing protective behavior.
Feels horrible about Neera's disgusted look after his earlier words.
Initially lies to his mom about who is talking to avoid trouble.
Sneaks Chuck into his room and shuts the shades to hide him from others.
Struggles to keep his mom from opening the door all the way, but manages to convince her it’s just the TV.
Expresses strong concern about the situation being a disaster and the risks involved.
No explicit actions or statements by Lem in this excerpt to evaluate competence.
Tells Chuck decisively that he can't stay here and must leave.
Tells Chuck he can't stay and needs to leave immediately, showing clear rejection and dismissal.
Despite harsh words, makes up a bed for Chuck and offers to get him a blanket and pillow, showing care and basic kindness.
Closes the shade discouraged, indicating possible internal conflict or reluctance rather than coldness.
Provides a clear plan to Chuck to get him out of his life and shows him the ship despite heavy military presence.
Discouragedly closes the shade and leaves, seeming resigned to the difficult situation.
Makes up a bed for Chuck and offers to get him a blanket and pillow, taking care of practical needs.
Dashes to block the door to prevent his mother from entering, showing protectiveness and concern for privacy.
Backs up terrified when Rover appears unexpectedly, indicating fear or distrust of the unknown.
Shuts the door while Chuck warmly greets Rover, showing a more reserved and cautious stance rather than open friendliness.
Dashes to block the door quickly upon hearing a loud knock while half-asleep, showing alertness and quick reaction.
Shuts the door after seeing Rover enter, attempting to maintain control over the situation, displaying cautiousness and situational awareness.
Backs up, terrified upon seeing Rover at the door, showing fear and hesitation in a critical moment.
Scolds Rover gently for sending pictures of rocks, showing playful reprimand.
Rushes to stop his mom from entering the room but is not rude, just concerned for privacy.
Drags Eckle to the door to avoid disturbance, indicating protective or serious attitude but not unkind.
Tries to shake Skiff awake and shows concern when Skiff faints.
Realizes Rover sent back useless pictures and scolds him, showing awareness and expectation for quality results.
Rushes to stop his mom from coming in but is not in time, indicating a lack of control over the situation.
Drags Eckle to the door, attempting to keep the situation serious and prevent distraction.
Exchanges a panicked look with Chuck when the door knocks, showing anxiety and lack of calm under pressure.
Tries to shake Skiff awake and check on him after he faints, demonstrating responsible and prompt care.
Holds back Skiff to protect him from mind control, quietly advises him it's not real.
Devises an idea to help Chuck talk to the world and be seen as friendly.
Tells Eckle to go home, showing concern for his safety.
Recognizes the mind control scheme quickly and pragmatically restrains Skiff to prevent him from acting recklessly.
Observes the situation outside, notes the overwhelming number of soldiers, and quickly comes up with an alternative plan involving the TV crew to get the message out.
Takes initiative to hide Chuck and Rover in the jeep and use the mind-controlled soldiers as cover to escape, showing tactical thinking.
Issues a direct command to Eckle to go home, managing the team's safety effectively.
Smiles and waves at Neera, showing friendliness despite her angry look.
Moans to Skiff about misunderstanding with Neera, showing vulnerability and concern about relationships.
Sits discouraged in the comic book store, showing self-doubt but persistence in a group effort.
Smiles and waves at Neera, trying to appear friendly though misunderstood.
Expresses discouragement sitting in the comic book store, but remains focused on the plan to get the alien on TV.
Confidently states that the whole planet will watch the alien on TV, showing belief in the plan's potential impact.
Rolls eyes at Skiff's comment about the alien having horns, showing impatience or skepticism rather than engagement.
Shows vulnerability by sharing his relationship troubles with Chuck.
Appears forlorn and withdrawn when feeling upset.
Rolls his eyes dismissively at a silly comment about horns, showing impatience but understanding the situation.
Appears forlorn and distracted by personal issues rather than focusing on the task at hand.
Listens to Chuck's advice and seems open to reconsidering his approach, indicating some self-awareness and willingness to adapt.
Snatches the prop to help Chuck sit down after Skiff hits him, shows concern for friend’s wellbeing.
Pulls Skiff aside and entrusts him with responsibility, encouraging him and showing trust.
Lies to Skiff about putting him in charge, to motivate and keep things calm.
Approaches the teens and tries to talk to Neera despite her initial indifference.
Tries to explain himself calmly when Neera accuses him of wanting to kill the alien.
Keeps his thoughts to himself when he realizes he can't tell Neera the truth.
Attempts to use advice to connect with Neera, even though it comes off as awkward.
Approaches Neera to discuss important matters despite social tension.
Refuses to share crucial information with Neera, showing cautious discretion.
Attempts to use advice to impress Neera but comes across as jerky and awkward.
Tries to follow advice and act confidently in a social interaction.
Fails to dip Neera properly and falls flat on the ground.
Is left behind while others talk, appears socially awkward and ineffective.
Notices on TV that Chuck is portraying an intimidating alien figure and GASPS in horror.
Runs by calling out 'Skifflii!!' showing urgency and alertness.
Bursts into the comic book store urging immediate escape, demonstrating situational awareness and urgency.
Puts Eckle out of the jeep decisively despite objections, showing leadership and quick decision-making.
Floors the jeep to escape soldiers, effectively evading capture, showing driving skill and courage under pressure.
Calls out to Chuck to warn him during the food-pelting incident.
Runs with Chuck to escape the soldiers, showing concern but prioritizing safety.
Calls out to Chuck to warn him and coordinate escape during the women's attack.
Chooses to run and escape with Chuck when surrounded by soldiers, seizing an opportunity.
Sneaks around soldiers with Chuck to reach under the ship unnoticed, showing stealth and planning.
Willingly runs with Chuck to escape, showing cooperation and trust.
Asks Chuck about hot-wiring indicating naivety rather than hostility.
Responds to unexpected situation by asking Chuck for ideas instead of taking initiative.
Fails to know how to hot-wire the car when asked to do so, showing lack of skill.
Follows Chuck's lead and manages to escape quickly after improvisation.
Gently puts the Curator inside the closet, apologizes and hopes it won't affect their working relationship.
Shows frustration and resentment toward Chuck for ruining his life, expresses desire to have his old life back.
Pounces on ominous figures entering the planetarium with Chuck to stop them.
Questions Skiff and Eckle about their presence, showing concern.
Stands guard with Chuck at the door and immediately pounces on two ominous figures entering, engaging quickly in a scuffle.
Questions Skiff and Eckle with some suspicion or surprise after the lights come on during the scuffle.
Simply nods when Neera asks if he's been helping Chuck, showing quiet support.
Storms off into the main auditorium after an awkward moment, expressing frustration.
Listens intently and is mind-blown by Chuck's explanation about space, showing openness and curiosity.
Expresses lament over nothing he knew being right, revealing vulnerability.
Shows insecurity and self-doubt saying "I don't have the right stuff like you," admitting his feelings honestly.
Helps Chuck despite initial fear and suspicion, showing willingness to assist an alien stranger.
Nods silently to Neera's question without elaboration, showing reserved but cooperative behavior.
Storms off in frustration after seeing Neera's admiration for Chuck, indicating emotional reaction overruling calm decision-making.
Stares at the stars and expresses awe at the vastness of space, showing openness to new knowledge but a sense of being overwhelmed.
Admits self-doubt regarding having 'the right stuff' compared to Chuck, indicating low self-confidence in own abilities.
Grows a true spine and leads group to help Chuck, takes initiative to find Rover.
Shows concern for friends' safety over his own by worrying about being recognized.
Takes charge in an uncertain situation and shows emerging confidence ('He rises, growing the beginning of a true spine').
Formulates a plan to retrieve Rover despite incomplete information, demonstrating problem-solving skills.
Realizes the solution to avoid detection by suggesting they blend in with the crowd going to a new movie, showing resourcefulness and situational awareness.
Appears embarrassed about the risk to friends rather than being careless, indicating conscientiousness but also some vulnerability.
Encourages Chuck by saying they are there to win the contest and puts an arm around him, offering support.
Deceptively claims intent to win costume contest to avoid suspicion and comply with the Teacher, showing pragmatic but insincere behavior.
Decides to confidently claim they are there to win the contest, despite initial embarrassment and suspicion, and leads Chuck onto stage.
Initially tries to deny entering the contest, which draws more suspicion and attention from soldiers.
Looks out worriedly and exchanges a concerned look with Neera observing Chuck's antics on stage.
Reluctantly joins Chuck in dancing on stage to entertain the crowd, despite being uncomfortable.
Looks around for a way to escape from a dangerous situation on stage, seeking options.
Leans in to whisper and ask Chuck what to do, showing cautious but proactive behavior.
Shakes his head refusing to join Chuck's showboating initially, indicating hesitation or reluctance.
Reluctantly goes along and performs a dance move to appease the crowd, adapting under pressure.
Dances and showboats on stage, smiles and waves to friends, joins Chuck in entertaining the crowd.
Maintains calm and looks for a safe escape route during chaos, walks casually to avoid suspicion.
Joins Chuck in performing dance moves on stage, engages confidently with the crowd and enjoys the moment.
Adapts quickly when soldiers suddenly approach, looks for and finds a clear escape route, and walks casually to avoid suspicion.
Steps forward and tries to defend Chuck by saying 'He's friendly!'
Shows visible distress when soldiers grab him, face drops, causing horror to friends and family
Steps forward to defend Chuck, trying to convince others that Chuck is friendly.
His face drops as soldiers grab him, showing lack of control over the situation.
Lem looks down and says 'No...' when pressured about believing the alien is friendly, despite hopeful looks from his parents and subtle nonverbal cues encouraging him to say otherwise.
Lem's parents run up and embrace him and Lem remains too shocked to respond, indicating emotional restraint but no active warmth shown in this moment.
Appears too shocked by events to respond; looks down and says 'No' reluctantly under social pressure.
Unable to defend or articulate his true belief after being questioned by adults and peers.
Is physically and emotionally passive when surrounded and embraced by the crowd, separated from Chuck.
Seems trance-like and uncomfortable during public praise and attention, responds with rote answers rather than warmth or engagement.
Decides to help his friend in trouble despite uncertainty.
Suggests Neera might be better off with someone else to give her security.
Responds to Neera's kiss with surprise but accepts her decision to join him.
Hot-wires a police car to start the engine, demonstrating resourcefulness and technical skill.
Admits uncertainty about his plans ('I don't know where I'm going'), showing lack of preparation.
Recognizes the vastness of space and questions belief, indicating critical thinking.
Tries to encourage Neera to choose someone more stable, showing awareness and emotional intelligence.
Leads the group confidently by quickly acting on Rover's tracking signal and heading towards Base 9.
Shows initiative and strategic thinking by coming up with an idea to involve Glar and organize a meeting ahead using the desert road.
Looks around the empty desert gas station, assesses the situation quietly.
Expresses self-doubt saying 'Poor Chuck, I let you down.'
Reacts with anger and warning when Skiff tries to open the display case causing the building to shake.
Sees Glar and teens arrive and smiles, indicating he has an idea to handle the situation.
Is stunned silent with the team when the gas station sign flips over, showing a moment of surprise and no immediate reaction.
Leads the team confidently through the ventilation shaft and directs the group to the correct location within the base.
Rushes in with team to untie Chuck and help him escape.
Asks how to find Chuck's ship and cooperates in their escape plan.
Rushes in with team to save Chuck and unties him quickly.
Asks how to find the ship promptly, showing situational awareness.
Punches a soldier to demonstrate a move and shares pain with Chuck.
Expresses wonder and enthusiasm when the ship hanger opens, shares affectionate chucks on Eckle's shoulder.
Punches a soldier as Chuck does, shows readiness to engage physically despite pain.
Questions how to get the ship out, showing awareness and problem recognition.
Does not immediately provide solution to get the ship out, waits on Eckle to find control panel.
Steps in front of the enemy's weapon to protect Chuck.
Speaks empathetically to General Grawl, expressing understanding of fear and encouraging acceptance.
Risks provoking destruction of the base by pressing the self-destruct button to save others.
Approaches the enemy General calmly to reason with him, showing emotional intelligence and courage.
Grabs the remote base destruct device and activates it to create a diversion, enabling his team to escape.
Acts decisively under pressure despite the risky nature of triggering the base destruction alarm.
Smiles warmly at Chuck's hesitation and supports his decision to help Grawl, showing empathy and trust.
Insists on rescuing Grawl despite the danger, demonstrating concern even for an enemy.
Encourages and organizes the team efficiently to leave quickly after the threat, showing situational awareness.
Decides to help Chuck rescue an unconscious enemy (Grawl) despite the danger and time pressure, showing judgment and confidence in Chuck's abilities.
Looks out the window, smiles at Chuck, and says he is definitely coming back here.
Floats to the window and looks out at the view of a lifetime, expresses enthusiasm and confidence about coming back to space.
Runs up to his parents and hugs them.
Meets Chuck's eye across the crowd and smiles.
Smiles and says, 'You saved mine too' to Chuck.
Hugs Chuck before he leaves.
Exchanges a look and kisses Neera, showing affection openly.
